Intro.p: A type of student enrolment with a school. Allows differentiation of concurrent enrolments, eg base vs other.

Description.p: The school that the student is considered to be primarily enrolled with, especially for the purposes of reporting and Ministry funding. Typically the student will spend most of their school time at this school.
Indicates an enrolment that is concurrent with the student's base enrolment at another school.

Indicates an enrolment with a school (typically Te Kura - The Correspondence School) which provides remote/distance learning; this means that the student remains at their base school (or at home) for all classes covered by this enrolment.

Intro.p: Records the status of a potentially multi-year Provider enrolment, which goes through a different life-cycle to the single-year school enrolment.

Description.p: Student has applied to become a Student at the Provider, this pre-enrolment has been received, and is being processed by the provider. It has not yet been accepted or declined by the provider.

The Provider has processed the application, validated it against school zoning rules, and other acceptance criteria. The provider has accepted the enrolment and will have a place for the Student if they choose to take it up. Student has accepted the enrolment and is expecting to take up the enrolment at the agreed future date.
The enrolment application has been declined by the Provider, or discontinued by the Student, prior to becoming an ACTIVE enrolment.
The student has taken up the enrolment, and has attended classes for the first time.

Value.Description: The Student has left the Provider, after the enrolment was made ACTIVE

Description.p: The enrolment has been accepted by the Provider, taken up by the Student, and the student has attended their first day; but the enrolment is unable to be set to ACTIVE, because there is still an ACTIVE enrolment for the student at a (previous) provider. Once the blocking Provider has put their enrolment to WITHDRAWN, this enrolment can be moved to 'ACTIVE'.

Intro.p: Enrolment Exit code, derived from code set used in School Roll Returns.

Value.Text: Transferred to Another School in NZ
Whakawhiti ki kura kē o Aotearoa
Expulsion (for Students Aged 16 and Over Only)
I panaia (mō te hunga ākonga 16 te pakeke neke atu anake)
End of Schooling (for Students Aged 16 and Over Only)
Kua mutu te kura (mō te hunga ākonga 16 te pakeke neke atu anake)
Granted Early Exemption (Applies to Those Younger Than 16yrs Old)
Whakaaetia kia wāteatia mai (e pā ana ki ērā ākonga tau heke 16 te pakeke)
Whakarerenga (mō te hunga ākonga tau heke 16 te pakeke)
Ka ngaro i ia te wā

Intro.p: The criteria used to determine the eligibility status of a student for enrolment and MoE funding purposes.

Value.Description: Includes Australian permanent residents.

Intro.p: Student classification for MoE funding purposes.

Codes in this list are hierarchical. Students can only be allocated one TYPE code (even though they may belong to more than one of the groups listed below). To allocate a code to an individual student, start at the top of the list and work down. Use the first code that applies to the student.

Value.Description: An International student who meets full tuition costs on their own or from funds provided to them by sponsors other than NZAID.
A student who is enrolled in an Alternative Education programme, for Funding Year Level they should be reported only between Year 9 and Year 13 (inclusive).
A student (and dependants) studying in New Zealand under an exchange programme approved by the New Zealand Government.
Code to be used for students attending on Roll Count Day, but not paying fee and not funded; e.g. students with Eligibility Criteria “28 Day Waiver” and “Extended 28 Day Waiver”.

A student who has continued at school and is at least 19 on 1 January of the Roll count year. EXAMPLE: Roll count year = 2017 if student is 19 years old on 1 January 2017 their student type = RA as there has not been a break in the students learning cycle.

A student who has returned to school following a break of at least 1 year and is at least 19 years old on 1 January of the Roll count year. EXAMPLE: Roll count year = 2017 if student is 19 years old on 1 Jan 2017 their student type = AD if there has been a break in their learning cycle.

A New Zealand student or a student treated for funding and staffing purposes as a New Zealand student who is also not yet 19 years at 1 Jan of the roll count year. This includes students in general classrooms and those in special needs units.

Value.Text: Teen Parent Regular Student Over Maximum Roll
Ranga Mātātahi, Ākonga kua aua atu i te taumata rārangi
Value.Description: A regular student (i.e. a student aged under 19 years at 1 January of the roll count year) who meets the eligibility criteria, but whose enrolment would cause the roll of the TPU to exceed the set maximum.

Value.Text: Teen Parent Adult Student Over Maximum Roll
Ranga Mātātahi, Ākonga Pakeke kua aua atu i te taumata rārangi
Value.Description: An adult student who is enrolled in a Teen Parent Unit (TPU) where the enrolment at the TPU has continued beyond the end of the year in which the student reached 19 years old. The enrolment of this student causes the roll of the TPU to exceed the set maximum.
A student enrolling at the TPU as an adult student (i.e. was at least 19 on 1st January of the year when they first enrolled at the TPU), and who fits within the TPU’s maximum roll.

Value.Text: Teen Parent Eligible and Enrolled Regular Student
Ranga Mātātahi me ngā Ākonga kua uru
Value.Description: A student who is enrolled in a Teen Parent Unit (TPU) and is at least 19 years old on 1 January of the current year. These students may continue to be enrolled in the TPU after the end of the year in which they turn 19, their Student Type however will then be changed to TPRAE – Teen Parent Enrolled Continuing Adult Student.

Value.Text: Teen Parent Enrolled Continuing Adult Student
Ranga Mātātahi kua uru hei Ākonga Pakeke e haere tonu ana
Value.Description: A student who is enrolled in a Teen Parent Unit (TPU) where the enrolment at the TPU has continued beyond the end of the year in which the student reached 19 years old.
A student who attends this school for some courses but is enrolled at another school where a majority of instruction occurs.

Value.Text: Student in a Satellite Class of a Special School
Ākonga o te akomanga kē o te Kura Motuhake
Value.Description: Student who is in a Satellite class of a Special School.
A student who is not attending the school on the day of the roll count and there is no documentation to support their absence from the school.

Value.Text: Student in a Separately Funded Unit
Ākonga kei ranga whai pūtea motuhake
Value.Description: Student is enrolled in a separately funded unit.

Intro.p: Codes denoting the level of ORS funding a student may receive.
The type of exchange scheme for student enrolment where the Eligibility Criteria is "Student on Government approved exchange scheme" (5).

Value.Text: Student Exchange Australia New Zealand Ltd.

Intro.p: The post school activity the student is moving on to once they have exited the school.
Code set denoting how the student's pre-enrolment was cancelled.
Code set denoting why the student's pre-enrolment was cancelled.
The type of early childhood education the student received.

Value.Text: I haere ki Te Kōhanga Reo
Attended Kindergarden or Education and Care
I tae ki te Kura Kōhungahunga, ki Education and Care rānei
I tae ki tētahi Ratonga ā-Kāinga
Attended Playgroup or Pacific Islands EC Group
I tae ki ngā kāhui kōhungahunga Pasifika, Playgroup rānei
Attended The Correspondence School - Te Aho o Te Kura Pounamu
I tae ki Te Aho o te Kura Pounamu
Attended, but only outside New Zealand
I tae ake, engari i waho kē atu o Aotearoa
Attended, but don't know what type of service
I tae ake engari kāre i mōhiotia te momo ratonga
Unable to establish if attended or not
Kāre e mōhio mēnā i tae atu kāore rānei

Intro.p: The level of instruction that is made in the selected language.

Value.Description: Student is taught in the specified language for more than 20 and up to 25 hrs per week (81-100% of total time).
Ākonga i ākona ki tētahi reo mō te 20 tae atu ki te 25 hāora i te wiki (81-100% o te wā katoa).
Student is taught in the specified language for more than 12.5 and up to 20 hrs per week (51-80% of total time).
Ākonga i ākona ki tētahi reo mō te 12.5 tae atu ki te 20 hāora i te wiki (51-80% o te wā katoa).
Student is taught in the specified language for more than 7.5 and up to 12.5 hrs per week (31-50% of total time).
Ākonga i ākona ki tētahi reo mō te 7.5 tae atu ki te 12.5 hāora i te wiki (31-50% o te wā katoa).
Student is taught in the specified language for more than 3 and up to 7.5 hrs per week (12-30% of total time).
Ākonga i ākona ki tētahi reo mō te 3 tae atu ki te 7.5 hāora i te wiki (12-30% o te wā katoa)
Student is taught in the specified language for 3 hrs per week.
Ākonga i ākona ki tētahi reo mō te 3 hāora i te wiki

Value.Text: iti iho 3 hāora i te wiki
Value.Description: Student is taught in the specified language for less than 3 hours per week or as a separate subject (0-11% of total time).
Ākonga i ākona ki tētahi reo mō te iti iho 3 hāora i te wiki, hei akoranga kē (0-11% o te wā katoa).
Student is learning Taha Māori.
E ako ana te Akonga i te Taha Māori.

Intro.p: Code set denoting the year level of students attending early childhood education.
